intro: Alsine intermedia, commonly known as smooth alsike, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm and has slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs. The leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often have a bluish-green hue. Its small, pinkish-white flowers appear in clusters and bloom from late spring to early summer. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
